eqcorrscan.core.thresholding module¶

Part of the EQcorrscan package written by Calum Chamberlain of Victoria University of Wellington in 2015. The main goal of this package is to generate waveform templates from continuous data and search for repeats of this waveform in continuous data using a match-filter cross-correlation routine.

The prupose of this module specifically is to determine thresholds for the use in various detection routines within the core modules.

eqcorrscan.core.thresholding.coherence_test(stream, stations, nodes, lags, wlen)[source]¶

Function to determine how the coherence of a day of contious multi-channel, multi-station seismic data varies with varying grid nodes. It would be wise to apply this to a day of seismic data thought to be quiet from within the grid given, and to a day thought to be loud with energy sources within the grid to see how this function varies.

Parameters:
  • stream (obspy.Stream) – Day of multi-channel, multi-station seismic data
  • station – List fo the stations in the same order as the delays
  • nodes (list of tuple) – A list of the node points as (lat, lon, depth)
  • lags (np.array) – Array of arrays where lags[i][:] refers to station[i] for all nodes and lags[i][j] refers to the lag for station[i] at node[j] should be in seconds.
  • wlen (int) – Length of window to determine coherence for - should be the same as your determined template length - in seconds
Returns:

coherence, array of arrays where coherence[i][:] refers to the running daily coherence at node[i]
